betterquesting:10.desc:8:
It is important to always stay hydrated. As the saying goes, if you ain't pissin' clear you ain't hydrated.

You probably have enough safe water in your canteen for now. Be careful to conserve your water, you don't yet know where you will find more....

You are probably going to drink a lot from your canteen. Fortunately, it's easy to refill! Just place it in a crafting window with a bucket of purified water.

Your canteen can hold three buckets of water, and each bucket of water restores three thirst.

The water is a nice find in this desert. You can fill your canteen with it, but be sure to purify it with some charcoal filters before you drink it.

Nobody wants to be sick out here.
It's kind of stale but still tasty in that way snacks can be. You can't live on these things alone, and be careful as they can make you thirsty.
Did you know that there is a difference between a cone and a delineator? And that delineators are sometimes called channelizers?
Zombies and Skeletons and Wraiths Oh My

Lots of rabbits out in this desert. You can cook the raw rabbit in a furnace. Makes it a little more edible.

You can also use it to tame some carnivores. Did you just hear a coyote?

You may find it easier to find edible meat and fend off the creepy monsters at night with a sword.

If you are unsure how to make a sword, take a look at the welcome to blocks questline.

There are a lot of tools and widgets to juggle as we stumble through autonomous zone to autonomous zone. A great way to  hold them is with a toolbelt! As common in the Block Rock Desert as throughout the multiverse. As much a fashion statement as they are practical.

You can craft one with leather, iron, and string. Out of the box, they can hold two items. Using an anvil you cand slap more tool pouches on to your belt and hold up to nine things!

To add something to your toolbelt, have the item you want to place into your toolbelt selected in your hotbar and press "R" (default key). You will then be presented with a selection wheel and if the toolbelt is not full, select insert. To remove something from your toolbelt, have an empty slot on your hotbar selected, and again press "R". Select the item you wish to extract.

That is how Minecraft generally starts. You punch a tree until you get a log of some kind. And then you make things with it. And then before you know it you are being chased through a darkened desert by coyotes.

While there are some things which can be crafted in a 2x2 such as torches or refilling your canteen, most will need a 3x3 crafting grid.

Some things will need a fancy crafting table, but we aren't there yet.

There is a lot of crafting in Minecraft. If you play your blocks right, there may even be more crafting than mining.

Your inventory (accessible by with "e" by default) has a small 2x2 crafting grid. Let's use this to break your logs down into some planks and sticks. You can create four species specified wooden planks by placing a log anywhere in your crafting grid. You can then make plain wooden stick by placing two planks on top of each other in the crafting grid.
Some words about charcoal and pollution I guess

betterquesting:10.name:8: we are all matter out of place
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
It happens in the multiverse. Something goes wrong, and you die. In this particular corner of the multiverse the penalty isn't that bad. So long as you can find your tombstone...

You should have a key in your hand. Hold on to it! You will need it to retrieve your inventory from your tombstone. Bring up your map (default key "j") and look around to find the little colorful dot marking your place of death. You should also see a beacon when you are in the normal display as well. Go find your tombstone - it should be in a safe place relatively close to your place of death.

Right click on your tombstone with the key, and try to not get fucked up again.

Usually there is a lot of mining in Minecraft. Even in this multiverse you need to do some mining before we can get to fully automated luxury queer block socialism. It will take a bit of work to get all the way there, and you will need to improve your skills to use all the neccesary tools.

As you gain experience, make sure to check the skills tab under your inventory (default key "e") to always keep learning and improving.
You put your smelts in here. Add some words about using JEI here

The string lights you brought will only light up so much. For now, you can use charcoal on top of a stick to make a simple and effective torch. As you progress, you will be able to make a wide variety of light producing items.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Wander all day, party all night
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
It takes a lot of supplies and preparation to have a good time. You are going to need more than your pockets and your tool belt. The simple backpack can be upgrade as you gain access to more advanced materials. Always make sure to empty it before you upgrade!

To put it on, bring up your inventory (default key "e"). Click on the baubles icon (a little ring in the upper right of your avatar display). Shift-click the backpack and you will now be wearing it (assuming nothing was already in the back slot).

betterquesting:10.name:8: Crates and Chests and Bins and Boxes
betterquesting:10.desc:8: There is so much stuff. Just so much. The storage crate is a great means of just bringing a bunch of shit with you. You can place it like a normal chest, but it can also be picked up again by whacking it with an axe. And it does not lose it's contents.

betterquesting:10.name:8: When all you have is a hammer...
betterquesting:10.desc:8: Lorem Ipsum WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM WHAM
There are better records in this modpack. I shold write some words about that later.
To start using the records you have found, you are going to need a record player.

While it's fun to shuffle around records in a block world, streaming in outside sources can also be nice. The Better Records Radio can be used with tuned frequency crystals to bring mp3 streams into minecraft.

Shift right click on the radio with an empty hand to open/close. When the radio is open, right click with a tuned frequency crystal to start the music. Right click on the radio open radio with a frequency crystal and an empty hand will cause the crystal to be ejected.

You can use a record inscriber to encode a HTTP url containing a mp3 into a record. I think it also works with ogg files?

Anyway, the default Better Records configuration in the Tribes That May Be modpack supports mp3's up to 800mb (bc some sets go into the sunrise) and should start playing the music as it is downloading.

Your mileage may vary.

You're finally here! It's true.

But where's everyone else?

Well, at least you've got me, your trusty quest book.

In case it isn't obvious, your current priority is survival.

First, try to remember what color the sleeping bag your brought with you is, airhead.

Next, exit my interface and take stock of your inventory.

Also, be sure to take a look at the quest "Such A User..." for some helpful info and a free goody.

The human body is generally anywhere from 50-78% water.

You should probably try to stay somewhere in that range if you'd like to survive.

Keep an eye on those little water drops at the bottom of your field of view to make sure you don't turn into a dusty little piece of jerky.

§nTask 1§r: Drink some water from your canteen.

betterquesting:10.name:8: So much for shade in the desert...
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
That is how Minecraft generally starts.

You punch a tree until you get a log of some kind.

Then you make planks out of it with your §obare, hands§r (or the 2x2 grid in your inventory).

Finally, before you know it you're being chased through a darkened desert by coyotes.

For the moment being, let's just stick to getting a crafting station built.

§nTask 1§r: Punch a tree until you get a log.
§n§nTask 2§r: Turn that log into planks.
§nTask 3§r: Make those planks into a crafting table.
§nTask 4§r: Turn that crafting table into a crafting station.

You should probably find a water source and use it to fill your canteen.

You can do this by §9crouch§ring + §9r-click§ring on a water block with your canteen in hand.

If it's an emergency situation, you can drink straight from standing water by doing the same thing with an empty hand, but you probably shouldn't do too much of that...

§nTask 1§r: Fill your water from a standing water source.

This quest will show you how to purify the water in your canteen with those handy charcoal filters you got.

All you need to do is combine your newly-filled canteen and a charcoal filter in a crafting grid to get some pure, tasty, H20.

§nTask 1§r: Purify a full canteen of water.

There is a lot of mining and crafting in Minecraft (never would've guessed from the name, right?).

Even in this particular Minecraft multiverse you'll need to do a significant amount of both before we can get to fully-automated, luxury, queer-block socialism.

It will take a bit of work to get there, and as you progress you will need to improve not only your tools, but the skills necessary to use them as well.

§nTask 1§r: Make sticks.
§nTask 2§r: Make your first pickaxe!

*As you gain experience, make sure to check the skills tab of your inventory to allocate the experience you'll be getting.

That trusty knife of yours is great and all, but let's be real... you should probably find a way to better defend yourself.

It's about time you armed yourself with §mknowledge!§r some sort of weapon.

This task should be pretty straightforward.

Go get stone.

§l§r§lQuick Tip:
§rIf you mine down far enough, you'll find "bedrock". Bedrock looks like the icon for this quest. You can't mine bedrock.
Don't let your eyes deceive you while diligently swinging away at it with your pickaxe. It's not going to work. I promise, on my honor as real news.

Being in a new environment can be challenging, as most of us are likely aware.

In an effort to mitigate frustration from UI troubles, listed below are some excerpts from my most helpful, less snarky pages that should serve you well.

§1Quest Book§r
First and foremost, while you can access the amazingly helpful knowledge I contain by using my physical form, I can also be accessed via hotkey (§1§d§5~§  §rby§r default), even if you lose me!

Next, while I try to be as succinct as possible and present everything on one page, you may need to §3scroll§r or use the §2arrows§r at the bottom of my pages to see an entry in full.
I apologize. I'm not as thin as I once was, as I'm now thick with knowledge!
Anyway, let's test the functions I mentioned on this entry.

§1Just Enough Items (JEI)
§rLet's move on to what will surely be your next best friend after me, the §5§rJEI interface§r.
This is the interface on the right (by default) when your inventory is open. It allows you to search for just about anything in this multiverse and both determine how to craft it as well as what you can craft with it!

§mDon't say anything, but I love the JEI interface. <3§r
*cough*

Alright, back to everything else.

§1General Controls§r
You can exit almost any interface with §l§5esc§r .

Almost all other controls can be found, edited, and completely made a mess of via the "§l§2Controls§l§r" option in the main menu. Careful.

Unfortunately, as far as I can currently tell from the vast knowledge in my pages, the dreaded §cNarrator§r can't be vacated from §l§5ctrl§r+§l§5b§r.
He's supes annoying, but shouldn't bug you if you don't poke him.

§WWhile we're on the topic of being unobtrusive, you can §3sneak/crouch§r by holding the assigned hotkey (§5shift§r by default) while you move.

§3Sneaking§r can even prevent you from walking off the edge of the block you're on (of your own volition). Just be careful not to get hit by something, as it can easily push you over the edge to your demise.

Now, let's talk about how to §3sprint§r! You can do so by holding down the assigned hotkey (§5ctrl§r by default) while you move.

Just bear in mind that if you're too hungry or thirsty, §3sprinting§r won't be an option.

§1Journey Map§r
You've got a map!
Yeah, you've got the minimap at the top right, but you can look at a larger version via hotkey (§1§5j§r by default).
Through this§r interface you can set and remove waypoints, see other nearby (or not-so-nearby players' locations), and view details of the areas you've discovered.

§nTask 1§r: Check the first box.
§nTask 2§r: Check the second box.

Over the course of your adventures, you're bound to come across many not-so-friendly entities.

It's truly a kill or be killed environment out here.

Time to show your mettle.

§nTask 1§r: Kill a hostile mob.
Make a furnace and charcoal.

By now, you should have an almost full set of leather armor.

While it's not the best defensive equipment you can get, it's better than nothing.

§nTask 1§r: Make some leather pants.

Bonus Task; Try to get that juicy peach into those tight new leather pants. ;D
^^ Not a real task. Don't overthink it.
How to survive in this multiverse.
It is a little dusty in here.
Everything you ever wanted to know about Minecraft but probably didn't know to ask.
Everything you ever wanted to know about music mods in minecraft but didn't know to ask.

Well, you finally made it to the desert. But why?

If you haven't already started questioning why you made such a horrible decision, you will shortly...

Naaah. While this won't necessarily be "easy", it should absolutely be fun.

What is in store for you has been crafted to provide an experience akin to an artistic orgy in the desert.

A pack for newbies and more experienced players alike, Tribes That May Be is here to help you create art, machines, and community in a desert survival environment.

Welcome. Now get down in the dust and roll around a bit so you don't look so out of place.
